page.title: 01HIGH DARTMOOR N OF 2 BRIDGES
page.content: The area is within the Dartmoor National Park, it us high peat moorland with areas of blanket bog. A number of granite tors crown the slopes. Trubutaries of both West and East Dart flow down from the high moor. Apart from one farm, the area is unpopulated. Sheep, cattle and ponies graze the lower slopes. The area has a number of bronze age relics, hut circles, kists, a stone row. Remains of medieval tinners' work and eighteenth centruy enclosure walls are present. The Devon Port Leat is taken off the West Dart in 9, an a dry Leat to Powder Mills crosses 8 and 12. 1, 5 and 9 are within the Merrivale Field Firing Area.
